page.title: 06Shipping near Dale
page.content: Our area includes part of the entrance to the busy oil-port of Milford Haven. Last year over 3000 dockings were made at the port.These ships all pass through our area,using the North or South Channel approaches.There are important buoys along their route, marking the channel and a submerged wreck.There is also a 200' high light tower which acts as a transit mark for the channel.Ships also use the services of tugs and/or a pilot.All sorts of ships and boats pass through our area including large tankers carrying crude oil from the Middle East and Africa,smaller tankers carrying other refinery products on local voyages,cargo boats carrying timber and scrap iron,fishing boats,and the Irish ferry.Some of thee anchor in Dale Roads or Dale Bay while waiting for instructions or the tide.
